JB Pritzker’s speech in New Hampshire, April 27, 2025   https://ericzorn.com/jb-pritzkers-speech-in-new-hampshire-april-27-2025/   >So when I was here about eight months ago, at the AFL CIO Labor Day breakfast, I laid out the bleak situation that we would find ourselves in if Donald Trump returned to the White House. Comment: Wikipedia:  Ocasio-Cortez was born in the New York City borough of the Bronx on October 13, 1989, the daughter of Sergio Ocasio-Roman and Blanca Ocasio-Cortez (née Cortez). She has a younger brother named Gabriel. Her father was born in the Bronx to a Puerto Rican family and became an architect; her mother was born in Puerto Rico. The family lived in an apartment in the Bronx neighborhood of Parkchester until Ocasio-Cortez was five, when they moved to a house in suburban Yorktown Heights. She said her family raised enough money to buy a small home there so she could go to school, and that her mother worked as a house cleaner in the town.   According to the national women's history museum,  family was working class. Not impoverished but not wealthy.  Dad died from lung cancer in 2008.

Comment: > it's not worth the risk when there is zero reason to create that risk in the first place  It's not a hard concept. You build support, you do not demand it. We are not in a good place right now. Right now is not a good time to demand that voters do what they don't want to do. At some point we will be in a better place and we can ask more of them. Going against reality is not a good idea right now.    >These voters are mostly white, christian and working class.  They prefer someone like themselves and will vote accordingly.  Democrats do not have to court 77,000,000 Republican voters. There's plenty of other people that can vote Democrat. What Democrats need to do is not snatch defeat from victory and not do stupid shit.   We need to fix voting first. Then we can nominate risky candidates. People need to spend more time on priorities instead of being selfish. Instead of trying to make electability a slur.   There's no good vs evil in the US Senate. It's just red vs blue.  >“The solution is that people don’t have to come to work to try to operate trains after they’ve had heart attacks and broken legs. But right now, where we are is caught between shutting down the economy and getting enough ***Republicans to join us*** in making sure that people have access to sick leave.”
